title: Why do some people hate table tennis? - Quora

response.answer_text: Frankly, it’s because people think it’s really “easy” and that anyone could play it well at an olympic level. To them I say. COME AT ME ON A FUCKING TABLE TENNIS TABLE AND I WILL POUND YOU INTO THE GROUND WITH A TABLE TENNIS BALL Now that we’ve taken care of that, Table Tennis is actually just as hard as Tennis. It actually requires more explosive muscle power in the legs and arms than tennis does. In other words, table tennis players are very muscular (not bragging or anything :p ) Aside from that, table tennis also requires extreme amounts of control, hand eye coordination and precision, and timing. The ball can be hit as fast as 150 km/h and sometimes even faster, this is a ball that’s barely 4 centimeters wide and is hard as fck to hit, especially when the other player is dropping it from corner to corner and you can’t just lob one over. The spins on the ball are so important.  You read the ball wrong, and someone serves a flat serve with barely any top spin and you end up reading it as backspin and chopping it? RIP They’ll smash your ass so hard you won’t even see it coming. (because physics dictates that the ball will go back very high which gives them ample opportunity to hit a hard smash) What else were you thinking that sentence meant??? ;) Anyways, aside from that, table tennis players have to train like crazy to reach even just a national level I’ve played about 7000 hours of table tennis in my “Career” and that’s nothing compared to what international players play. The rackets are also sexy and look much better than standard tennis rackets.  This racket is my go to - it costs 150 dollars alone and it’s on a relatively low end of the scale. This is just the carbon fibre/wood composite blade mind you But still, it looks fucking dope and I have multiple of these - if you’re superficial, the fact that people spend up to 700 dollars on a table tennis racket should mean that the sport is pretty serious. Name a Tennis player that pays 700 dollars for 100 grams of racket? Exactly, there are none Anyways, this was a bit of a tangent, but maybe you’ll get why I tend to kick anyone who scoffs and laughs at table tennis right in the face

Though it may not apply depending on where you live, let me point out two reasons (Which at the very least, applies to where I live) Firstly, there are very, very few shops that sell quality bats. (Though I believe in the this phrase “The worker blames the tool”, do continue to read) As a result, people who play using bats that are of lousier quality even with dedication to it, may find it very hard to play the game altogether. Secondly, people often think that table tennis is a very easy sport to play. Thus, (though I’m not discouraging people from self-learning) people with zero experience try to learn from the internet on how to play when table tennis is a game which needs some form of supervision (E.g. An experienced coach) so that whoever is supervising can correct that person who is learning. What’s more, there are very few table tennis coaches at where I live which does not help the situation. Thus, some people give up on table tennis rather early when it is a relatively simple sport to pick up with appropriate coaching. (Though it is simple to pick up, it is hard to master)
